isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - IC BUS SERVICE MANUAL - OPERATION - WARNING DEVICES

svcsubproc.title: Audible
svcsubproc.para: The body options warning devices are audible (buzzers) and visual (lights). Rear door buzzers will sound in the driver's area ( Figure 6) when the ignition is "ON" and the rear or side emergency door latch is open. It will also sound when the roof hatch latch is open or the push-out window latch is unlatched.

svcsubproc.title: Visual Warning Lights
svcsubproc.para: On school buses equipped with lift doors, an Amber light located on the driver's console ( Figure 7) or the dash will illuminate when the door latch is unlatched. When this light is "ON", it is a WARNING that the door is not locked. This warning light is activated when the lift door latch is not locked and the ignition is in the "ON" position.

figure.caption: Figure 7. Location of Amber Warning Light for Lift Door

svcsubproc.title: Eight Lamp Warning System
svcsubproc.para: The eight lamp warning system will be an amber and red flashing light that flashes on the driver's console ( Figure 8) when the exterior eight lamp warning lights are activated. Each light will only come on when the respective exterior light is activated in the system. For instance, the red tell-tale light only comes on when the red warning lights are activated. Units equipped with a light monitor system will have the red and amber tell- tale lights deleted.

figure.caption: Figure 8. Amber and Red Tell-Tale Light Location
